docs.lead_paragraph: A good pediatrician is like an extra parent, someone who knows a child well enough not only to diagnose strep throat and chickenpox but also to offer advice on subjects from toilet training in toddlers to emerging sexuality in teenagers. Yet finding a pediatrician who fits a family's needs can be hard.

headline.main: Invest in a Child's Future: Shop Smart for the Right Doctor

docs.abstract: Parents looking for pediatrician should interview several candidates before deciding on best doctor for their family; Dr John J Connolly, president of Castle Connolly Medical Ltd, which publishes book America's Top Doctors, asserts that many people spend more time picking movie than selecting doctor; questions to ask and things to look for in selecting physician discussed (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The thing about children is that sometimes they misbehave. They disobey. They talk back. They ignore their chores and fight with their siblings.

headline.main: Scream at Your Own Risk (and Your Children's)

docs.abstract: Researchers have shown that yelling at children can become form of abuse; Bonnie Harris, parent educator and author of book When Your Kids Push Your Buttons, holds that parents who yell set poor example of social interaction and although yelling may not be abusive, it can impact how their children relate to others in life; impact of yelling on development of children discussed; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: Children whose parents consistently raise their voices or combine yelling with insults, criticism, ridicule or humiliation may suffer from depression, dips in self-esteem or demonstrate more aggression themselves.
